page.title: 11PORT ELPHINSTONE INVERURIE
page.content:
The "port in the country" is what Port Elphinstone is. It was the port at the inland end of the Aberdeenshire Canal. Many houses were built to provide housing for people connected with the canal. Today almost all that remains to remind us of the canal are the names of some of the houses and some of the streets. e.g.Canal Road, Ladeside Road.
As well as houses, a number of mills were built near the canal. These included grain, meal and bone mills non of which are still in use today. The canal and the mills brought people to Port Elphinstone and the community grew.
In 1854 the canal was closed to be replaced by a railway line which followed the route of the canal.
